record.title: ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, JUNE 13, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., Wednesday, June 13; that on Wednesday, following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day, and there be a period of morning business for 60 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the first half under the control of the majority and the second half under the control of the Republicans; that 20 minutes of the majority time be under the control of Senator Brown or his designee; that upon the conclusion of morning business, the Senate resume consideration of H.R. 6, as under the previous order.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
